short_summary: To investigate the performance of corrugated fibreboard boxes with varying grammage configurations but equivalent Edge Crush Test (ECT) values and to determine if grammage requirements can be replaced by ECT values.
description: This RFP aims to determine whether Edge Crush Test (ECT) value alone can be a sufficient specification in determining the performance capability of a single or doublewall corrugated fibreboard box or whether the grammage (i.e. basis weight) value is a necessary component in demonstrating fibreboard box performance in accordance with UN performance testing.
tags: Free Trade Agreements (including CKFTA and CFTA)
full_summary:
===============

### Tender Announcement: Grammage and ECT in Performance Assessment of Fibreboard Boxes

#### [English](#english) | [Français](#français)

#### Overview
---------

Transport Canada invites proposals for research to determine the correlation between grammage (basis weight) and ECT (Edge Crush Test) values in the performance assessment of fibreboard boxes. The proposed study aims to explore whether ECT value alone is sufficient to evaluate the performance capability of a single or doublewall corrugated fibreboard box, or if grammage is a necessary component.

#### Background
------------

Fibreboard manufacturers have made advancements in producing fibreboard with reduced material while maintaining its strength, measured through ECT. As a result, stakeholders face challenges in obtaining grammage information, which often differs from the original values or falls outside the permitted variations.

#### Objectives
----------

*   Determine if grammage is a necessary specification to ensure strength quality of fibreboard boxes and the performance of UN standardized combination packaging
*   Investigate if ECT is a sufficient specification to evaluate the strength and robustness of a fibreboard box and the performance of UN standardized combination packaging

#### Study Methodology
----------------

*   Conduct UN standardized performance testing on combination packagings consisting of a fibreboard box and four HDPE rounded-off square bottles
*   Test fibreboard boxes with equivalent ECT values and varying grammages

#### Deliverables
------------

*   Provide a comprehensive report detailing the findings and recommendations
*   Develop a report outlining the necessary specifications for fibreboard boxes, including grammage and ECT values

#### Eligibility
------------

This tender is open to all suppliers who meet the eligibility criteria outlined in the attached documents.

#### Documents
------------

The tender documents, including the RFP and attachment, can be accessed through the Canada Buys website.

#### Deadline
-------------

All proposals must be received by [2023-01-09T14:00:00]

#### Point of Contact
----------------

For inquiries, please contact Natasha Blackstein, natasha.blackstein@tc.gc.ca, 343-550-2321.

#### Notice
-----

A detailed notice of this RFP is provided in French and English. Translations of documents on the Canada Buys website are subject to change. Please reference the original language versions.
